channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [HIVE-2961] Remove need for storage descriptors for view partitions
item.description:
Storage descriptors were introduced for view partitions as part of HIVE-2795. This was to allow view partitions to have the concept of a region as well as to fix a NPE that resulted from calling describe formatted on them.

Since regions are no longer necessary for view partitions and the NPE can be fixed by not displaying storage information for view partitions (or displaying the view's storage information if this is preferred, although, since a view partition is purely metadata, this does not seem necessary), these are no longer needed.

This also means the Python script added which retroactively adds storage descriptors to existing view partitions can be removed.
item.summary: Remove need for storage descriptors for view partitions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
kevinwilfong requested code review of "HIVE-2961 [jira] Remove need for storage descriptors for view partitions".
Reviewers: JIRA

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-2961

Removed the need for storage descriptors for view partitions and the script to add them.

Storage descriptors were introduced for view partitions as part of HIVE-2795. This was to allow view partitions to have the concept of a region as well as to fix a NPE that resulted from calling describe formatted on them.

Since regions are no longer necessary for view partitions and the NPE can be fixed by not displaying storage information for view partitions (or displaying the view's storage information if this is preferred, although, since a view partition is purely metadata, this does not seem necessary), these are no longer needed.

This also means the Python script added which retroactively adds storage descriptors to existing view partitions can be removed.

TEST PLAN
EMPTY

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D2877

AFFECTED FILES
metastore/scripts/upgrade/001-HIVE-2795.update_view_partitions.py
metastore/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/metastore/HiveMetaStore.java
metastore/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/metastore/HiveAlterHandler.java
ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/describe_formatted_view_partitioned_json.q.out
ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/describe_formatted_view_partitioned.q.out
ql/src/test/queries/clientpositive/describe_formatted_view_partitioned_json.q
ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/metadata/formatting/MetaDataFormatUtils.java
ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/exec/DDLTask.java

MANAGE HERALD DIFFERENTIAL RULES
https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/view/differential/

WHY DID I GET THIS EMAIL?
https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/transcript/6525/

Tip: use the X-Herald-Rules header to filter Herald messages in your client.
I agree with Kevin. Since, views are purely metadata it doesnt make much sense to have a storage-descriptor associated with them.

ashutoshc has accepted the revision "HIVE-2961 [jira] Remove need for storage descriptors for view partitions".

+1 will commit if tests pass.

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D2877

BRANCH
svn
Based on the discussion at today's contrib meeting it sounds like we can drop this patch and instead backout HIVE-2795 and HIVE-2612. Does that sound good?
But if we end up taking that route, I think we should leave the upgrade-0.8.0-to-0.9.0.xxx.sql scripts for the sake of consistency.
We can revert those two patches instead. This patch does fix a null pointer exception that occurs for DESCRIBE FORMATTED on a view partition. But I can submit that in a separate patch.
We can revert those two patches instead. This patch does fix a null pointer exception that occurs for DESCRIBE FORMATTED on a view partition. But I can submit that in a separate patch.

But if we end up taking that route, I think we should leave the upgrade-0.8.0-to-0.9.0.xxx.sql scripts for the sake of consistency.

Do you mean delete the content of the file, thus effectively leaving empty files, since there is no upgrade needed when we revert those patches?
Canceling patch since current patch may not be valid after HIVE-2795 is reverted.

Do you mean delete the content of the file, thus effectively leaving empty files, since there is no upgrade needed when we revert those patches?

Yup, that's basically what I meant, but now that I think more about it I agree that it doesn't make much sense.
Fixed via HIVE-2966
This issue is closed now. It was released with the fix in 0.9.0. If there is a problem, please open a new jira and link this one with that.

item.title: [HIVE-2962] Remove unnecessary JAR dependencies
item.description:
The tarballs currently include a bunch of JARs which aren't real Hive dependencies. I think in most cases this is caused by unnecessary transitive dependencies that are getting pulled down by Ivy.

Also, once the contents of the lib directory are sanitized we need to reconcile it with the list of dependencies in the LICENSE file.
item.summary: Remove unnecessary JAR dependencies

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Attaching Ivy dependency reports generated on the 0.9.0 branch.
Fixed via HIVE-2970

item.title: [HIVE-2963] metastore delegation token is not getting used by hive commandline
item.description:
When metastore delegation tokens are used to run hive (or hcat) commands, the delegation token does not end up getting used.
This is because new Hive object is not created with value of hive.metastore.token.signature in its conf. This config parameter is missing in the list of HiveConf variables whose change results in metastore recreation.
item.summary: metastore delegation token is not getting used by hive commandline

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: HIVE-2963.1.patch - This is a trivial patch - it adds hive.metastore.token.signature to HiveConf.metaVars. I can't think of any non-trivial way to add an unit test for this.
This patch fails compilation of test target. You can reproduce it with ant clean package test
HIVE-2963.2.patch - fixes test compile problem
Same root cause as in HIVE-2918. No longer a problem after that went in.
This issue is fixed and released as part of 0.10.0 release. If you find an issue which seems to be related to this one, please create a new jira and link this one with new jira.

item.title: [HIVE-2964] Provide object inspectors of all visible columns for TOK_FUNCTIONSTAR type UDAF
item.description: Currently, TOK_FUNCTIONSTAR type UDAFs are provided with empty OI at init time and is sufficient for sum, the only UDAF accepts START as a parameter. But for some UDAFs, it is needed to know all OIs that can be used to access values of a row.
item.summary: Provide object inspectors of all visible columns for TOK_FUNCTIONSTAR type UDAF

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:

EMPTY

item.title: [HIVE-2967] Statement.updateQuery() returns Method Not Supported exception
item.description: When our software sends a CREATE TABLE command to HIVE via JDBC, a Statement.updateQuery() statement is issued which results in a Method Not Supported exception. We did not get this error in the previous version of Hive (0.7.1). Please advise, did something change within the 0.8 JDBC driver, is a statement like this no longer supported?
item.environment: Remotely connecting from a Windows machine via JDBC to Hive installed on Linux Kernel-2.6.18-glibc-2.5 x86_64 64bit
item.summary: Statement.updateQuery() returns Method Not Supported exception

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-2968] Add char(n), character(n), character varying(n), and varchar(n) as datatype aliases for string.
item.description: MySQL and Postgres support char(n), varchar(n), character(n), and character varying(n) as data types. In Hive, those would map to strings. It would be useful to support these types as aliases when creating a table.
item.summary: Add char(n), character(n), character varying(n), and varchar(n) as datatype aliases for string.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-2969] Log Time To Submit metric with PerfLogger
item.description: Logging the time from when Driver.run starts to when we begin submitting jobs to map reduce would be helpful in determining how much of the lag in starting a query is due to Hive vs. Hadoop.
item.summary: Log Time To Submit metric with PerfLogger

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
kevinwilfong requested code review of "HIVE-2969 [jira] Log Time To Submit metric with PerfLogger".
Reviewers: JIRA

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-2969

Added Time To Submit to the PerfLogger, beginning just after the PerfLogger is first initialized, and ending just before the loop which starts submitting jobs to map reduce.

Logging the time from when Driver.run starts to when we begin submitting jobs to map reduce would be helpful in determining how much of the lag in starting a query is due to Hive vs. Hadoop.

TEST PLAN
EMPTY

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D2919

AFFECTED FILES
ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/log/PerfLogger.java
ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/Driver.java

WHY DID I GET THIS EMAIL?
https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/transcript/6651/

item.title: [HIVE-2970] several jars in hive tar generated are not required
item.description: The hive 0.9 build is currently producing tar which contains 31 additional jars when compared with 0.8 release, and most of them are not needed.
item.summary: several jars in hive tar generated are not required

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
HIVE-2970.1.patch - With this patch the only additional jars in 0.9 are the jackson jars.
jackson jars have Apache 2 license, so no changes are needed in LICENSE file.
HIVE-2970.2.patch - previous patch excluded same jar twice, fixed that.
HIVE-2970.3.patch - extra jars were getting included with previous patch, fixes that

Following jars are also not required at runtime by Hive, so can be excluded:

  • ant-contrib-1.0b3.jar
  • asm-3.1.jar
  • commons-codec. Hive needs 1.4 not 1.3 of it.
  • hive-anttasks-0.10.0-SNAPSHOT.jar not required in distribution.
  • junit
  • mockito
  • velocity
HIVE-2970.4.patch - Excluding the jars mentioned by Ashutosh in previous comment, and also antlr jars except for the runtime jar.
Committed to trunk and 0.9. Thanks, Thejas!

Integrated in Hive-trunk-h0.21 #1391 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/1391/)

item.title: [HIVE-2971] GET_JSON_OBJECT fails on some valid JSON keys
item.description:
hive> SELECT GET_JSON_OBJECT("

{\"Form Name\": 12345}

", "$.Form\ Name") FROM akramer_one_row;
Mapred Local Task Succeeded . Convert the Join into MapJoin
OK
NULL

...this also returns null for "$.Form Name" and "$.Form
Name". It should return the relevant key.

Removing the space works fine, however, spaces are allowed as JSON keys (see spec at http://www.json.org/ ). As such, this is a bug.

Claiming that this is org.json's problem, or something similar, does not solve this bug. It's Hive that claims this gets a JSON object, so it needs to provide the JSON object.
item.summary: GET_JSON_OBJECT fails on some valid JSON keys

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Yes, removing space like the following works fine:

SELECT GET_JSON_OBJECT("

{\"FormName\": 12345}

", "$.FormName") FROM akramer_one_row;

Patch is ready for review:
https://reviews.facebook.net/D3033
Committed, thanks Gang.
Kevin, thank you. You lead me through the whole process. You are my hero last week thanks again Gang

Integrated in Hive-trunk-h0.21 #1419 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/1419/)

item.title: [HIVE-2972] SENTENCES() crashes with SMP characters
item.description: The sentences function does not handle characters in the supplementary unicode plane (BreakIterator crashes with ArrayIndexOutOfBounds).
item.summary: SENTENCES() crashes with SMP characters

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Related to http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=7104012
If it is a JDK problem that hive can not work around why not close the issue?
I think we should open until there's at least a workaround in place. If there's no workaround we should at the very least catch the exception so that the job does not die.
Fair enough if we can trap it.

item.title: [HIVE-2973] LOAD DATA INPATH doesn't work when HDFS port is explicitly specified
item.description:
If hive.metastore.warehouse.dir is hdfs://namenode/user/hive/warehouse, doing:

LOAD DATA INPATH 'hdfs://namenode:8020/user/myname/temp-dir' INTO TABLE foo

Doesn't work (complains about different filesystems).
item.summary: LOAD DATA INPATH doesn't work when HDFS port is explicitly specified

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-2974] Add online docs for from_utc_timestamp() and to_utc_timestamp()
item.summary: Add online docs for from_utc_timestamp() and to_utc_timestamp()

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
hive> describe function to_utc_timestamp;
describe function to_utc_timestamp;
OK
There is no documentation for function 'to_utc_timestamp'
Time taken: 0.053 seconds
hive> describe function from_utc_timestamp;
describe function from_utc_timestamp;
OK
There is no documentation for function 'from_utc_timestamp'
Time taken: 0.053 seconds
hive>

Carl,
can you review this patch.

Here is the RB link.
https://reviews.apache.org/r/15471/

Overall: +1 all checks pass

https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12613525/HIVE-2974.1.patch.txt

updated the patch with test case

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ReportingPhase

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12614025

Doc note: The wiki already documents from_utc_timestamp() & to_utc_timestamp(), but it would be good to add the examples from this patch.

from_utc_timestamp('1970-01-01 08:00:00','PST') returns 1970-01-01 00:00:00

to_utc_timestamp('1970-01-01 00:00:00','PST') returns 1970-01-01 08:00:00.

  • Operators and UDFs – Date Functions
Superseded by HIVE-8003

item.title: [HIVE-2976] Fix maven-build Ant target
item.summary: Fix maven-build Ant target

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
With this change:

ant clean package maven-build

...

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 1 minute 55 seconds

@Thomas,

Carl also has a fix for this, albeit a different one at https://reviews.facebook.net/D2937 I am not sure why didn't get published back on jira.
The change from Carl will sidestep the issue. The change I made will keep it consistent with the other modules.
Please note that in any case, maven-build will require that package has run before. That's due to the way the builtins module is setup currently.

Thomas's approach is better than mine.

@Thomas: Can you update your patch so that the maven-build target depends on package instead of jar?
Switched the maven-build dependency to package.

+1

Committed to trunk. Thanks Thomas and Andrew!

Seems to work fine (Andrew already updated the patch). It would mean though that package runs multiple times depending how you run the build. For reference, test also does not depend on package, you need to run

ant package test

item.title: [HIVE-2977] Type widening on Union Alls doesn't make sense.
item.description:
When type widening occurs in a UNION ALL query between a STRING column and a BIGINT column, both are casted to DOUBLE which doesn't make any sense since this is lossy for both inputs. It should cast both to STRING.

Additionally this should throw an error in strict mode.
item.summary: Type widening on Union Alls doesn't make sense.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-2978] IN should throw an error in strict mode if types do not match
item.description: If the types do not match in strict mode (bigint vs string), then this should throw an error (in the same manner as the equality operator).
item.summary: IN should throw an error in strict mode if types do not match

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

This issue is fixed and released as part of 0.10.0 release. If you find an issue which seems to be related to this one, please create a new jira and link this one with new jira.

item.title: [HIVE-2980] Show a warning or an error when the data directory is empty or not existing
item.description:
It looks like a good idea to show a warning or an error when the data directory is missing or empty.

This will help in cut down the debugging time as well a good information to have on the deleted data
item.summary: Show a warning or an error when the data directory is empty or not existing

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: This certainly is not an error condition. Table with no data (dir) is a valid use case. I am not even sure about warning. When yo do select on empty table, you get 0 records back, what else do you expect?

I think this maybe relevant to the table or partition status,when create a new table or partition ,the table will store "NEW" status in metastore,if is delete or drop,status will change to 'DROPED',if table is create using load DML ,status will be 'LOADED',when using desc command,it will print the table or partition status to help user understand the last status of this table.

and maybe this will help stats gather,if table or partition status is "NEW" or "DROPED", we know that there is 0 row in this table or partition, if table or partition status is "LOADED" or "INSERT" ,we can continue to gather table stats.

currently,the transient_lastDdlTime is a little useless since it didn't not indicate which DDL user use.I suggest change this to two new status:"update_time" and "status", update_time means last time user "insert","insert overwrite","drop" ,status will include "NEW","LOADED","INSERT","DROPPED" status.

I tend to disagree with Ashutosh. When a table is created a corresponding directory is created in the in /<hive path>/warehouse. So, technically, this directory is part of the table metadata. Therefore, if this directory is erroneously deleted, the table metadata is in a inconsistent state and the user should be notified about it. If you remove all the files inside the directory, then its the same as an empty table and a select should pass with 0 rows returned.
